org.miloss.fgsms.plugins.sla

Interface SLARuleInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PluginCommon
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActionContainsIgnoreCase, ActionEqualsIgnoreCase, AllFaults, AllSuccesses, BrokerQueueSizeGreaterThan, ChangeInAvailabilityStatus, ConsumerContainsIgnoreCase, ConsumerEqualsIgnoreCase, CustomSLARule, FaultsOverTimeGreaterThan, FaultsOverTimeLessThan, HighCPUUsage, HighCPUUsageOverTime, HighDiskUsageOverTime, HighMemoryUsage, HighMemoryUsageOverTime, HighNetworkUsageOverTime, HighOpenFileHandles, HighThreadCount, InvocationsOverTimeGreatThan, InvocationsOverTimeLessThan, LowDiskSpace, MeanTimeBetweenFailureGreatThan, MeanTimeBetweenFailureLessThan, QueueOrTopicDoesNotExist, RequestContentContainsIgnoreCase, RequestMessageSizeGreaterThan, RequestMessageSizeLessThan, ResponseContentContainsIgnoreCase, ResponseMessageSizeGreaterThan, ResponseMessageSizeLessThan, ResponseTimeGreaterThan, ResponseTimeLessThan, StaleData, TransactionalAgentMemoContainsIgnoreCase, XPathExpression

    public interface SLARuleInterface
extends PluginCommon
    Service Level Agreement Rule Plugin Interface - This will allow developers to add custom Rules into fgsms.

    All implementations should be stateless

    Deployment Instructions

    To deploy your own implementation of an SLARuleInterface implementation, build your jar file and any supporting jars and copy them to each fgsms server that contains fgsms.AuxServices.war and fgsmsServices.war in the WEB-INF/lib folder

    To use your implementation

    Use the PCS web service to set the service policy for a specific web service, adding an SLA with a SLARuleGeneric as the rule and at least one action defined. Use SLARuleGeneric to define the implementing class as your implementing class. Optionally, specify any per service settings necessary for making a rule determination. This can also be done from fgsmsWeb and fgsmsBootstrap web user interfaces.

    Since:
    6.2
    Author:
    AO
    See Also:
    PCS, SLARuleGeneric, org.miloss.fgsms.services.interfaces.policyconfiguration.SLAActionGeneric, NonTransactionalSLAProcessor, RuleBaseType, Utility, AuditLogger, DBSettingsLoader, SLACommon, SetServicePolicyRequestMsg, ServicePolicy, SLA

      • CheckTransactionalRule

        boolean CheckTransactionalRule(SetStatusRequestMsg req,
                             List<NameValuePair> params,
                             AtomicReference<String> nullableFaultMsg)
        Returns True is the rule's conditions have been met (SLA Violation) This represents when a Status message comes in to the status service, such as from an OS agent. This function should never throw an exception
        Parameters:
        req - Set Status message
        params - per service policy, rule instance parameters this can be null
        nullableFaultMsg - the human readable text explaining what happened or why the rule was triggered
        Returns:

      • CheckNonTransactionalRule

        boolean CheckNonTransactionalRule(ServicePolicy pol,
                                List<NameValuePair> params,
                                AtomicReference<String> nullableFaultMsg,
                                boolean pooled)
        Returns True is the rule's conditions have been met (SLA Violation).

        This is used for non transactional rules. Implementors should access the database and perform whatever calculations are required in order to determine if the rule's conditions are met or not.

        This function should never throw an exception.

        The calling function is typically the NonTransactionalSLAProcessor which operates on a set schedule that can be adjusted by administrators. It operates using the Quarts schedulers

        Since no data is provided, an implementor is expected to access data on their own. To access global settings

        Open the fgsms databases

         Connection con =null;
 if (pooled)
  con= Utility.GetPerformanceDBConnection();
 else
  con = Utility.GetPerformanceDB_NONPOOLED_Connection();
 //or use Utility.ConfigurationDBConnection(); for the configuration database
 try {
 // do something
 } catch (Exception ex) {
 // log some message
 } finally {
 if (con != null) {
 try {
 con.close();
 } catch (Exception e) {
 }
 }
 }

        Parameters:
        pol - This is a reference the service policy that this rule is attached to. Do not modify, unexpected results may occur
        params - per service policy, rule instance parameters this can be null
        nullableFaultMsg - the human readable text explaining what happened or why the rule was triggered
        pooled - Indicates the usage of pooled database connections or not
        Returns:
        true if the rule indicates that a problem has occurred
        See Also:
        NonTransactionalSLAProcessor, RuleBaseType, Utility, AuditLogger, DBSettingsLoader, SLACommon, SetServicePolicyRequestMsg, ServicePolicy, SLA

      • ValidateConfiguration

        boolean ValidateConfiguration(List<NameValuePair> params,
                            AtomicReference<String> outError,
                            ServicePolicy policy)
        Validates the configuration settings. This is called by both the user interface as well as whenever someone attempts to add or change a service policy containing this federation target.
        Parameters:
        params - parameters for this instance for a SLARule for validation
        outError - human readable error message representing whatever the problem areas are
        policy - a reference to the proposed service policy
        Returns:
        True if the configuration is valid, false otherwise
        Since:
        6.3

      • GetType

        AlertType GetType()
        If the rule is triggered, this defines what type of rule this is. This is used to determine which type of Alert Type is sent to subscribers
        Returns:

      • GetHtmlFormattedDisplay

        String GetHtmlFormattedDisplay(List<NameValuePair> params)
        returns a html encoded string contain usually the rule name plus the configured values. Encrypted values should use the field ENCRYPTED_MASK. Input params list may be from direct user input, therefore you should validate the input before processing. Html is allowed, javascript is not example: "Response time is greater than 50 ms" "Consumer Identity contains (encrypted)
        Parameters:
        params -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        StringEscapeUtils, Utility
